main event: A very bright, round, bluish-green flash of light the size of a basketball was observed in Paynesville, W. Va. on February 18, 1958.
interesting points: The object was observed for 10 seconds.
The source of the observation was a civilian airline.
The report concludes the object was possibly 'ball lightning'.
The report does not contain any photographs.
There is a reference to a previous report on October 17, 1957 in Paynesville, W. Va.
sighted object: a very bright, round, bluish-green flash of light the size of a basketball
